title: Re: site update,
content:
I won't register the forums 'n' stuff, but I like 'corner stone of God'. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] It's interesting to see a religious site in a Keen network.
Anyways, I like the simplicity of "how to become a christan". It's good, since there really isn't more required. At least nothing else comes to my mind.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: site update,
content: I think I should join your forum... It looks great.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]    I also like "corner stone of God".[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]    It's nice to see a religious twist in a Keen site for a change. Just one suggestion for it. You should add [url=http://www.christianforums.com/]www.christianforums.com/[/url] to the links in "corner stone of God".[img]http://images.ucomics.com/comics/ga/2005/ga050705.gif[/img]

title: Re: site update,
content:
The "Corner Stone of God" section is unrelated to the Keen site, for your information.

Man, Christiansforums.com is one big site. I wonder how many forums can claim to match that number of users/posts...

EDIT: [url=http://www.gaiaonline.com/forum/index.php]Gaia Online[/url]'s 300 million posts beats that by just a little bit. Wow.
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.
Possibly the [url=http://legion.gibbering.net/misterx/troutwar.php?s=grafix5000]funniest thing[/url] on the interweb.
Go to [url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url] to see my site!

[img]http://www.toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobblersig.php[/img]
